info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 9:18PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...THUNDERSTORMS WITH TORRENTIAL RAINFALL WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN UNION COUNTY NORTH CAROLINA UNTIL 1000 PM EDT... At 917 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm with torrential rainfall 7 miles southwest of Monroe, or near Mineral Springs, moving east at 20 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Monroe, Wingate, Marshville, Mineral Springs, Sturdivants, Wesley Chapel and Trinity. Very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas. Street flooding is very likely and some streams and creeks may approach bankfull.
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters.
